column4: Is there anything in a vanilla Lucid that blocks incoming port 80 connections (netstat notes that its listening)
there shouldn't be
what's the best way to debug this then - as noted I removed my router and am connected straight to the cable modem - ISP notes not blocking anything, what can I do next ?
sorry mate, just describe your issue again, can't find it now

been having a REALLY tough time with apache2 (on lucid) - I thought it was the router, so I removed it and am now connected straight into the cable modem, the ISP (cox) says they are not blocking ports but I can't seem to be able to access port 80 from the outside - localhost works just fine.  Ideas ?
maybe a quick workaround would be to install No-IP?
are you trying to a Local Hosted webpage from Public?
No-IP as in no-ip.org ?  Sorry not following...
no-ip.com

yeah, I installed apache2 and can see the "It works" from localhost (ie. 127.0.0.1) but if I try to access my IP_address from the outside (ie. the internet) I don't get through - ssh works fine, vnc works fine, if I look at the apache logs so access entry, etc - its simply not coming through from the looks of it
it very much looks like its being blocked but where - the ISP says "not me", I removed the router (so its just the ISP's cable modem) and the lucid box - so what can I do further to debug this ?
I'm thinking... but it feels like I'm Sinking
hehe
ok, tried something else and that worked
what did you try?
instead of 80 I modified apache2 to use 3389 (just for grins) and that works fine - I can see the "It works"
so port 80 is definintly  being blocked but where and how
cool man!
I'm not allowed to type my thoughts
is there ANYTHING within lucid that might be blocking port 80 ? I don't have a firewall installed/used
I should think not, no reason to be, lemme just remember quick, there is a site somewhere that allows u to test all open Ports on your IP
will get back to u just now
tried canyouseeme.com and it said that 80 is no visiable from outside (what else is new :-) the question is how best to debug this
http://canyouseeme.org/
